Here is a summarized version of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

* Endorses the recommendation that realism and a spirit of compromise are essential to achieve progress in negotiations on Western Sahara (para 3).
* Calls on parties to show political will and work in a spirit of dialogue to implement previous resolutions and achieve a solution (para 4).
* Supports the Secretary-General's efforts and welcomes the intensified pace of meetings and contacts (para 5).
* Calls on parties to negotiate in good faith, without preconditions, to achieve a just and lasting solution providing for self-determination of the people of Western Sahara (para 6).
* Invites Member States to assist in the talks (para 7).
* Requests the Secretary-General to keep the Council informed on the negotiations (para 8) and provide a report on the situation in Western Sahara (para 9).
* Welcomes the commitment of parties and neighboring states to review and expand confidence-building measures (para 10).
* Urges Member States to provide voluntary contributions to fund confidence-building measures (para 11).
* Requests the Secretary-General to examine challenges to MINURSO's operations (para 12).
* Extends the mandate of MINURSO until 30 April 2012 (para 13).
* Requests the Secretary-General to ensure compliance with the UN's zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse (para 14).
* Decides to remain seized of the matter (para 15).
